comments.body: This seems weird. I thought we had just established data was a string ?
`data` is an abstract field of type dict which will contain str, integers, lists and other dicts, which are returned or passed to HPE OneView.
Right, I see I have misread the if-else statements there. Sorry.

To be honest, I would leave it up to the Exception object to check if the 3 parameter is fine, rather than make 2 almost identical calls here. But that's just a mental note I made, not a requirement per se.
Changed this to leave up to the `Exception` and then changed back, it makes unit testing expectations a little bit uglier without the if. If this is acceptable as is, will leave it alone for now.

So I am not sure this is the best way to do this. I would simply look for each of the variables at the various locaions, and merge them all together, using a precedence rule: parameter over config over environment.

But this is something you can add later. Not something you have to worry about now.
